quote: "God is more interested in your future and your relationships than you are."
"Doctrinal rightness and rightness of ecclesiastical position are important, but only as a starting point to go on into a living relationship - and not as ends in themselves."
"People who have good relationships at home are more effective in the marketplace."
There is no more lovely, friendly or charming relationship, communion or company, than a good marriage.
To be loved by God is the highest relationship, the highest achievement, and the highest position in life.
"Impart as much as you can of your spiritual being to those who are on the road with you, and accept as something precious what comes back to you from them."
"I know the Bible is inspired because it inspires me."
"Eloquence is a painting of the thoughts."
"Ah! dear friend, you little know the possibilities which are in you."
"The test of a preacher is that his congregation goes away saying, not What a lovely sermon, but, I will do something!"
"There are no rules of architecture for a castle in the clouds."
"To me a lush carpet of pine needles or spongy grass is more welcome than the most luxurious Persian rug."
"Never be so brief as to become obscure."
"History belongs to the intercessors - those who believe and pray the future into being."
"Passion drives perfection."
"It is better to be a wooden vessel filled with wine, that a golden one filled with water."
"Since He looked upon me my heart is not my own, He hath run away to heaven with it."
"First John 3:16 shows that true love is climaxed by our being willing to lay down our lives for fellow believers."
"In the time we have it is surely our duty to do all the good we can to all the people we can in all the ways we can."
"By faithfulness we are collected and wound up into unity within ourselves, whereas we had been scattered abroad in multiplicity."
"Patience is the companion of wisdom"
"The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it."
"Everyone feels benevolent if nothing happens to be annoying him at the moment."
"Press on. Obstacles are seldom the same size tomorrow as they are today."
"The moment an ill can be patiently handled, it is disarmed of its poison, though not of its pain."
"We are always on the anvil; by trials God is shaping us for higher things."
"It is hard to wait and press and pray, and hear no voice, but stay till God answers."
"One of the great disadvantages of hurry is that it takes such a long time."
"It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are, the more gentle and quiet we become toward the defects of others."
"I can see, and that is why I can be happy, in what you call the dark, but which to me is golden. I can see a God-made world, not a manmade world."
"We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world."
"Joy is the holy fire that keeps our purpose warm and our intelligence aglow."
"To keep our faces toward change, and behave like free spirits in the presence of fate, is strength undefeatable."
"Security is mostly superstition. It does not exist in nature."
"I thank God for my handicaps for, through them, I have found myself, my work, and my God."
"Some of your greatest blessings come with patience."
"Those times when you feel like quitting can be times of great opportunity, for God uses your troubles to help you grow."
"There are three indispensable requirements for a missionary: 1. Patience 2. Patience 3. Patience."
"If I have made any improvement in the sciences, it is owing more to patient attention than to anything beside."
"If I have done the public any service, it is due to my patient thought."
"Teach us, O Lord, the disciplines of patience, for to wait is often harder than to work."
"Slight small injuries, and they will become none at all."
"A good horse should be seldom spurred."
"A Christian without patience is like a soldier without arms."
"Patience is the queen of virtues."
"Baptism is faith in action."
"Baptism is an outward expression of an inward faith."
"Baptism separates the tire kickers from the car buyers."
"Baptism is bowing before the Father and letting him do his work"
"Baptism is the initial step of a faithful heart."
"I do not elevate the time or mode of baptism to a primary doctrine."
"A helping word to one in trouble is often like a switch on a railroad track an inch between wreck and smooth, rolling prosperity."
"If I can put one touch of rosy sunset into the life of any man or woman, I shall feel that I have worked with God."
"If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give"
"Good words are worth much, and cost little."
"Since new developments are the products of a creative mind, we must therefore stimulate and encourage that type of mind in every way possible."
"Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow."
"What a blind person needs is not a teacher but another self."
"You will find, if you think for a moment, that the people who influence you are the people who believe in you."
"Compliments cost nothing, yet many pay dear for them."
"Open your heart to sympathy, but close it against despondency. The flower which opens to receive the dew shuts against the rain."
"God hath made it a debt which one saint owes to another to carry their names to a throne of grace."
"The tear that is wiped with a little address may be followed, perhaps, by a smile."
"Love and pity and wish well to every soul in the world; dwell in love, and then you dwell in God."
"Your greatest pleasure is that which rebounds from hearts that you have made glad."
"What you applaud you encourage, but beware what you celebrate."
"What a noble gift it is, the power of playing upon the souls and wills of men, and rousing them to lofty purposes and holy deeds."
